it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Game.Board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Game.Board.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board is a set of all the Region of the Game in which can be placed a FamilyMember. In a Board there are informations about:
    • region: ArrayList of all the Region present on the Board.
    • towerRegion: static array of TowerRegion.
    • #productionRegion: a ProductionRegion.
    • #harvestRegion: a HarvestRegion.
    • #councilRegion: a CouncilRegion.
    • #marketRegion: a MarketRegion.

    On the Board it is possible to get the reference to all the regions of the game.

    Author:
    VaporUser.
    See Also:
    Region, TowerRegion, ProductionRegion, HarverstRegion, CouncilRegion, MarketRegion.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Board constructor.

        The constructor does not need any parameters. It calls all the region's constructors. It sets the regionID for all the region on the board:

        • For #productionRegion it sets regionID 0.
        • For #harvestRegion it sets regionID 1.
        • For #councilRegion it sets regionID 2.
        • For #marketRegion it sets regionID 3.
        • For towerRegions it sets regionID 4, 5, 6, 7.
        See Also:
        Region, TowerRegion, ProductionRegion, HarverstRegion, CouncilRegion, MarketRegion.

    • Method Detail

      • getRegion

        public Region getRegion(int regionId)
        Get method for a generic Region in the Board.

        It is helpful to get informations about the Region in the Board. If the number passed is not a RegionId valid, returns null.

        Parameters:
        idRegion - integer of the Region to get the reference.
        Returns:
        Region in Board which has Region#RegionID == idRegion.
        See Also:
        Board, Region.

      • blockZone

        public void blockZone(int playerNumber)
        dependent on the value of playerNumber arguments, block the actionSpaces of the region according to the game rules
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - the number of players in the game

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String which can easily printed on the screen. It is helpful for debugging, testing and visualize all the attributes of the Board.

        This methods calls the toString() methods of all Region class present on the Board.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String which has all the information of the Board and its Regions.
        See Also:
        Board, Region, TowerRegion, ProductionRegion, HarverstRegion, CouncilRegion, MarketRegion, ActionSpace.
